info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 4 at 3:01PM MDT until August 8 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
...MULTI-DAY CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THIS WEEK WITH LITTLE OVERNIGHT RELIEF...
.A multi-day critical fire weather event is ongoing this week due to low RH values into the teens and single digits, alongside poor overnight recoveries and gusty winds. Overnight recoveries may rise a little higher or winds a bit less breezy on some days, but overall conditions will be poor for a majority of the week.
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon Tuesday to 6 PM MDT Friday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 419.
* WIND...Gusting 20-30 mph, isolated gusts 35-40 mph.
* HUMIDITY...8 to 12 percent; overnight recoveries as low as 25 to 40 percent.
* IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR LOW RH, POOR OVERNIGHT RECOVERY, AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 419

area.areaDesc: North Laramie Range and Adjacent High Plains
